Reviews.Title: “Not so bad”
Reviews.Author: Nada D
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from Rome. We stayed in this hotel because our travel agency had put us in. It is right across the train station Termini and is extremely noisy unless you get a side room. There were several groups of children from Spain and Italy who were parting all night, slamming the door and shouting. There was a weird smell in the room. Maybe it is because the hotel is very old. But the best is the location. Everything is within reach in no time. Metro is across the street, Via Nazionale is five minutes away, you can walk and enjoy Rome. Breakfast was average, but you do not come to Rome to eat in a hotel. So we didn't mind. There are much better hotels in Rome, but this one is not the worst, though the room per night for two persons costs 115E. I have the impression that there are cheaper hotels on the same locaton.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best, not the worst”
Reviews.Author: Nes005
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because this is the hotel my Contiki tour had put us in. First of all, they need to work on their cleaning, I happened to drop my sweat shirt on the floor in this Lobby area on the 1st floor, I picked it up and it was completely covered in dust, like it hadn't been swept in a year. The room was great! Very spacious. The bathroom was small but was handy to have a heated towel rail considering it was winter. My only issue with the bathroom is that the shower was tiny! It was a corner shower and half the entrance of the shower was blocked by the corner of the sink being in the way so you had to squeeze around the sink and step around the toilet to get into it. Also there were no shelves in the shower to put your soap yet barely enough room to bend over to pick up your shampoo bottle that you had to put on the floor! Location of the hotel was good, right across the road from the Termini train station and also lots of places to eat. Probably wouldn't recommend walking around the back of the hotel, poorly lit, dodgy people loitering about and looked like the ghetto. Kind of enjoyed the church bells chiming at 7am and later in the day. Hotel staff were friendly apart from the waitress in the breakfast room who would stand there and watch over us like a hawk. it made for very uncomfortable dining. One other thing that bothered me is that my room mate and I were asleep in our room down the corner end of a corridor, when at 3am someone came stomping down the corridor straight up to our door and started jiggling the door handle and then quickly left when the door didn't open. They didn't even try to use a key. Thankfully we remembered to lock the door!

Reviews.Title: “Unless on a tight budget”
Reviews.Author: Samantha T
Reviews.Content: Not exactly the kind of hotel you'll wanna stay in after a long flight. This hotel is old and there's a musky smell in the room. Thankfully, we were only there for a night. However there are quite a number of eateries nearby and the Roma Termini train station is just right opposite the hotel, where you could not only purchase train tickets, you could also buy bus tickets to the Castel Romano outlet store.

Reviews.Title: “great budget room”
Reviews.Author: HolidayHayley
Reviews.Content: great location - easy to get back too as you are right next to the train station. My room was a little worn but spotless. It was a bit noisy when young people were partying in neighbouring room and moving though the corridors - but it was not a big deal,still fell asleep just fine. My room was a single with a double bed on the 6th floor. Clean sheets, clean room, safe that worked and loads of towels. Shower kept going really hot and cold - every few seconds. Good breakfast room for groups. Breakfast was fine - not wow - but simple cheese/ham/croissants/juce and coffee. TBH - I have no idea how much it costs to stay here - but if the rooms are cheap- then you should have a really pleasant stay. If the rooms are costly, find somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, decent European hotel”
Reviews.Author: julesgrl215
Reviews.Content: I'm 18 years old and I stayed at this hotel in Rome with my mom from August 13-16 2011. Let me start my review by saying that the location is just wonderful. It is directly across the street from the Termini train station, so you never have to worry about getting lost in Rome. Just find any bus stop and for 1 euro you'll take the bus to Termini. The location is phenomenal. And for a quick word of advice to anyone who wants a great grocery store in Rome, on the lower level of the train station there is a huge supermarket. It's definitely the place to get any food or drinks you want very cheap. Moving onto the actual hotel...personally as long as there is working a/c and water and a bed, that constitutes a good hotel to me. I'm not very picky and I didn't go to Rome to hang out in a hotel room. The hotel room was a good size and the bathroom was a surprisingly good size for Europe. The shower was very small though. The staff weren't the friendliest people ever though, but when I needed to make a phone call, they helped me. One thing that disappointed me was that there was no WIFI at the hotel. Overall, I loved Rome and I thought that Hotel Siracusa was a great hotel that met all our needs. I would recommend 100% simply because the location made traveling around Rome a breeze at all hours of the day and night.

Reviews.Title: “honest and genuine review, all truth”
Reviews.Author: nikki g
Reviews.Content: my friend and I, both 21 years old, stayed here from 6th-13th August 2011 as our hotel went into liquidation and our travel agent arranged this one for us. came onto trip advisor and read the reviews and was absolutely horrified and dreading my stay here. i'm going to be as honest as possible, and for the record although we are 21, our standards of cleanliness, safety noise etc are high. when we first arrived we checked in and headed up to our room 207. the lift was absolutely tiny it was a struggle getting ourselves and two cases into the lift. we arrived at our room and although it was small, we did a once over of the bathroom and bedsheets and they were clean. in the cupboard there was also a safety deposit box, which we were glad of. **positives** clean room, comfortable bed, good location for reaching termini station (its just across the road), our room had a balcony which was nice for sitting looking out and hanging towels out to dry, no noise (there was a loud american family next door but we only really heard them during the day once or twice) staff were friendly enough to us, clean towels and maid service every day. good powerful warm shower. on our day of departure, check out was 12midday but our flight wasn't until later so we asked if the staff could keep our bags and this was no problem. they lock it away in a room for you until you need to go to the airport! **negatives** when someone flushes the toilet in another room or somewhere in the hotel, we heard a rush of water as if it was going down a pipe, sounded like torrential rain outside, the shower has no curtain like everyone has mentioned therefore when you take a shower, the bathroom will end up soaked. the maids do give you plenty of towels tho so it can be easily dried. our safe broke on the thursday so we had to lock our valuables away in our cases. cant give an opinion of breakfast as we were never up in time to eat, breakfast was 7am-10am! also, although they never bothered us, there are a few homeless people who hang around termini station, so be careful. this hotel is by no means the Ritz, but it is not as bad as some people are making it out on their reviews. Our room was one with a balcony, not all rooms have this. this hotel is fine if all you want is a base for your time in rome. it is also located just down the street from the Terravision bus service which takes you to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “this is the best place to make your life worse”
Reviews.Author: shienchii
Reviews.Content: the worst hotel service i have ever received, is the 4 stars self proclaimed? i have done many travels, from the most posh treatments to the cheapest backpacking lodge. but this is the worst i have even seen. THE STAFFS ARE THE ONES RESPONSIBLE FOR SPOILING THE ENTIRE TRIP, we were poorly greeted when we checked in the hotel, as our flight arrived an hour earlier than check in time, i was rudely told that i was too early and to return later in the day. the old man concierge always reply me in the utmost disgust, and it is clearly shown in his facial expression and body language, he doesnt even look at me in the eye when we converse- it doesnt take a genius to realize this is just poor courtesy. i strongly felt disrespected by the staffs- when i was filling up water from the breakfast table, the waitress yelled at me for emptying their jug of water, perhaps it is my inability to understand italian, but never have i been yelled by a waitress before. the shower and bath had no partitions with the rest of the washroom, so u will definitely wet the whole toilet by the end of the shower. the tv set in my room was faulty too, as it is not capable to receive satellite programs. never would i want to visit this place again although the location was a good one.

Reviews.Title: “The staff was very BRAVO ! :)”
Reviews.Author: vladikbravo
Reviews.Content: The staff was very BRAVO ! :) The location of hotel is the best !

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: eliHk
Reviews.Content: We had to stay at Siracusa because our booked hotel closed down few days before our arrival. Our travel agency recommended it due to its location: right outside Termini Train Station. Very very poorly mantained, if at all. AC would not work at all times, smelly rooms, stained bedspreads, dust on the floors, broken toilet seats, no shower curtains, unconfortable beds and pillows...It is also an hourly hotel! The only relief was the understanding staff who tried to do their best upon our complaints. It must be that they have no choice but to keep on earning their living under the terrible economic situation which has affected Europe, as we witnessed. We had been to Italy before but had never experienced such a disgusting hotel, nor anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Stay AWAY!”
Reviews.Author: maggie30
Reviews.Content: My review will start on the positive side first, the location is the best its right outside Termini Train Station. This is the only posivive sign. The Room: Before you walk into this hotel there is a sign that shows 4 stars, but when you walk into your room it looks more like 2 stars (and I am being genoerous). We opened the door of our room and you find the beds right there, no space to pass with your luggage. The bathroom has this huge tube with no shower curtain. Water spatters all over the place its messy. My issue: When you check in you must prepay. My father gave the front desk his credit card, and there was a problem on their part because the credit card machine line wasnt working. So they told us if we wanted to stay there we had to pay cash. Being that we didnt have anywhere else to sleep we were obiligated to give them the last euros we had on our last night in Italy. I explained this to her, I told her I didnt want to exchange any more money because we where traveling back home the other day. She said well you need to pay cash if you want to sleep here. I asked if we can try the credit card later on and she could give us our money back. She said yes. Two hours later the credit card machine was still down and I asked if she would call the credit card company and ask for a approval manually so that we would have our room paid for and we could have our cash back she said NO. Then we asked if we can pay in US Dollars (some countries let you) she said this is Europe and we use Euros here.(I wish I could expian the gestures she was making) then I told her she should learn how to treat a customer and learn when she should shut her mouth. Then she called me arrogant. SHe was lucky my father pulled me away from answering more.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great staff”
Reviews.Author: rightr
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful; the continental breakfast was convenient; the location was perfect; the room was quiet. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: Statboy2008
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Siracusa in March. I was a part of a college group of 54 people and we stayed at Siracusa for 6 nights. The hotel is across the street from the main train station in Rome, so as is the case, there was hustle and bustle almost 24 hours a day, with the exception of early morning (2-5 am). The hotel is also near a church with bells so the bells go off every hour. This almost gives a more pleasant feeling. The rooms are accomodating. My room was a little small, but considering I had three roomates, this was to be expected. The beds were nice and provided a good nights rest - no bugs BTW. The showers were cramped with pretty little room to maneuver to do the basic essentials (pick up things etc.). There was a smell from the sewer system, but it was nothing that culdnt be overtaken with some air freshener and the window cracked a little. Overall, it was a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A perfectly ok hotel!”
Reviews.Author: fruitcake28
Reviews.Content: Just come back from 5 nights stay in this hotel. There were 17 of us in our group, students and tutors, and no one had any complaints. My single room was small but clean, with shower, loo, basin, bidet, tv, phone, hair drier, safe, and air conditioning. The shower was powerful, with plenty of hot water, even very early in the morning, and the air conditioning worked very effectively! The breakfasts were excellent, lots of choices of food and drink, and plenty of it! The breakfast rooms were clean, sunny and airy. The staff were courteous, friendly and helpful. My room was at the back, so I didn't have a street view as some of my fellow travellers did, but the upside of that was that it was very quiet at night. The hotel is very well situated for getting around Rome, as it is directly across the road from the Termini (bus/train station). Yes, I have stayed in fancier hotels, but if you want a reasonably priced, centrally situated, clean place to stay in Rome, you could do a lot worse than here!

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel! by pazza dottoressa, Merksem (Belgium)”
Reviews.Author: dottoressaMerksem
Reviews.Content: What's the problem with this hotel, folks? I just returned from a 4-day stay in Rome in "the worst place on earth", the Siracusa. I didn't run as far as I could. Well, I confess: I travelled a lot in Italy with schoolgroups (I am a teacher), and I've never stayed in such a pretty place like this. The breakfast was - compared to Italian standards - luxurious: two types of cereals, cheese, mortadello, ham, yoghurt, fresh bread (instead of crackers), drinkable coffee, cake, fruit pie, fresh fruits etc. In my room I discovered some other luxuries: a shower wall (never seen in Italy in a three star hotel) and air conditioning (working!). The room was cleaned (I looked desperately for the bed bugs...) every day and there was no need to open the windows for half an hour because the room smelled. Even the hotel staff was not too rude or too chaotic (quite exceptionnal in Italian three star hotels). So my conclusion is: if you are looking for a basic hotel in a good location (transportation, bars, food stores, supermarkets...), just go for the Siracusa. The neighbourhood of the Termini station is not so attractive, but safe by day. Don't mind the litter, the streetsellers, the beggars and the shabby hotel façade, they are quite harmless. Some other travellers on this site were complaining about the tiny rooms in the Siracusa, but that's rather common in Italy; by the way, you will spend most of the time outside. I would recommend this hotel to anyone (even senior travellers) who needs just a place for the night and is looking for a well located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel of our trip”
Reviews.Author: pcoke
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a school trip from the states and this hotel was our last impression of Europe. It was a very bad one! Customer service was horrible. The rooms were tiny, some rooms didn't even have toilet paper in them... several rooms had lots of bugs...they looked like tics..they were so bad one set of students had to be moved to another room. There were other European school groups there that had no control over their students. Many were running up and down the halls until 3am. When we called the front desk to complain not much was done. I would never stay in this hotel and I am dissappointed that our tour group picked this one. However, I will not name the tour group because the rest of our trip was wonderful! I just hate it that this was our students last impression of Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Student Groups”
Reviews.Author: kayakbluepenguin
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a trip to Rome with a group of 34 middle school children and 10 teachers. It was sponsored by EF Tours. When I read the Trip Advisor reviews posted about the Hotel Siracusa, I was both disappointed and worried, as we had no control over the hotel that was selected. Once we arrived, however, I was pleasantly surprised. Yes, the hotel was across the street from Termini, but none of us was ever accosted by anyone. We educated our kids in safety and assertiveness skills with street merchants and pickpockets made it a point to have at least one chaperone per 5 kids throughout our entire trip. Interestingly, our kids had more encounters with scam artists in other parts of the city (e.g. Piazza Novana and outside the Vatican), but were perfectly safe because we stayed close by and would not let them give their money away. There were 2 or 3 internet cafes around the corner and a handy shop next door for purchasing chocolate, pastry and gelatti at very reasonable prices. There were also many nice shops, an ATM and a pharmacy across the street at the train station. We learned that in most cafes where you are not sitting at a table, you must tell the cashier first what you want to buy, pay for it, and then bring the receipt to the counter. The hotel was typically European, with a tiny lobby, marble floors and large windows, but also limited space in each room. This was OK for us because we spent most of our waking hours on the go so we could enjoy every aspect of Rome in the limited time we had. The beds were comfortable and nice looking. We had no problems with "bed bugs" or air conditioning (it was February) as sited in other reviews. A few times our students blew out fuses for using the wrong kind of hair dryer and the staff were very accommodating and patient with us. We had almost an entire floor to ourselves and so our students often congregated in the halls until 10 PM or so. We noticed, however, that most of the people staying in the hotel were student groups and some were much louder and less supervised than ours. This is definitely not a place for a couple to take a romantic getaway, but perfect for the needs of a group of students, especially if you are on a group tour with a company that has a good relationship with the staff and can communicate with them for you. Finally, the breakfasts were very different from Amercian breakfasts, but perfect for our needs. There was an espresso/cappucino machine, milk, cereal, red orange juice (which was delicious), rolls, coldcuts and fresh fruit.

Reviews.Title: “The five star hotel for terrible services”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For a nicely located 3 star hotel, you would expect they should be able to provide the basic services any traveler needs. However, it is simply not the case. 36 of us (34 master degree students in hospitality management plus 2 tutors) booked the hotel well in advance for our acdemic visit in Rome. On our arrival, they did not have enough rooms for all the girls, so 10 of them had to share two rooms with 5 girls in each room. When we checked in our rooms, some of the beds had no blankets. By the time that was sorted, it was 3.00 o'clock in the following morning. If this was bad, there was the worse. One girl had flea stings over her arms, shoulders, back and legs. When we complained to the front office staff, they did not even offer their apologies. In fact, they never smiled at us during our 5 day stay. Whoever wants to stay in this hotel, please think twice before you make your decision. Don't be deceived by the pictures on their home page.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Customer service ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we arrived early and they were great then later when we came to pick up our keys they were awful. the two women at the desk acted like it was a huge imposition for them to check us in. then they were rude and laughed at us in italian which we all happened to speak. then next day they cleared out one of our rooms as if we had checked out which we had not and refused to call the manager becuse they might get fired. finally the clothing was located but it was locked in the maids room who lived outside of rome and refused to come back into the city. then the next day they didn't get their stuff til checkout and when asked if they would be compensated they were told NO. never was a manager called or supervisor as they told us they would be fired, they couldn't even call him if the building was on fire we were told. the rooms were nice but the service was so horrendous that i would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I loved the Siracusa!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be terrific; it's right across from the train station, and it was not expensive at all (80 Euros per night, including breakfast). My room was small but just fine; a double bed with good reading lights over the bed, a tv, wonderful bathroom with bidet and shower, plenty of hot water, a beautiful thick green patterned bedspread, matching the curtain. The door was a beautiful, thick wooden door, and the floors were of stone, and there was a huge mirror in the room and tall ceilings. My room was on the 'court side' (as opposed to the street side) and it was very quiet till morning (when other guests started getting up). I found the hotel to be clean, pleasant, safe, and the people at the front desk to be helpful. They also have a nice-looking breakfast room though I did not eat there because I took an early train to the Rome airport (it's very handy -- all I had to do was walk across the street). Being right by the train station, this hotel is also easily accessible by local bus and subway. I also walked from the hotel to the Colesium, and to the piazza de Venezia (this latter destination took awhile) and even to the Vatican, though that was not close by. But if you like to walk it's do-able. They gave me a map at the front desk and helped me with directions. All in all, I was very pleased with this hotel and would definitely stay there again. I thought it was good value for the money and as a female traveling alone on this trip, I value feeling safe, and feeling comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay good accomodation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel from 13 october until 19 october 2005. We, a group of 70 students and 8 teachers had a pleasant stay at the hotel. The rooms were proper cleaned each day. Only two student rooms had small complaints and within a day everything was made okay. The year before we had a stay in a two star hotel (in Rome) which had a lot to complain about. The Siracusa hotel (three star hotel) should not be called a youth hostel as I read in other reviews. I would recommend this hotel to other schools its worth a trial, good service, normal good breakfast, proper service and nice personnel. Its location near Termini station gives you an excellent starting point for daily travel in Rome. We had a very fine week in Rome. St Laurenscollege, Rotterdam, Netherlands

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The only good about this hotel was the location. It is across the street from the train station, buses & taxis. The hotel advertises air conditioning but we could not get ours to cool the room at all. After the first night, we asked to change rooms. Not much different! When it is 100 degrees outside you expect a cool room to sleep in! No shower door and water got all over the floor after each shower. Room was very small and the bathroom was even more crowded. The breakfast offered nothing much and we had fresh fruit on olly one morning. The best thing about the meal was the coffee from a machine. That says a lot!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: birdnut
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Siracusa from May 30th to June 6th. The location was close to the Termini Station, which gave convenient access to public transit, including the 110 open bus. The area seems to attract people who sit on the curbs at night and drink. They leave quite a bit of garbage, but it gets cleaned up in the morning. We were on the third floor and our room was a good size compared to others in Europe we have stayed in previously. The bathtub didn't have a shower curtain and when we showered there was water all over the floor. We decided to take baths for that reason, but water still got on the floor. The tub itself must have been leaking. The toilet ran continually and we kept the bathroom door closed at night so that we didn't have to listen to it. When they finally turned on the air conditioning June 1st, water started dripping from the ceiling, where we had to walk into the bathroom. My husband slipped and fell, but fortunately did not hurt himself. The help from the desk consisted of a couple of extra towels to put on the floor. The breakfast was minimal. Very tough rolls, melba toast, ham and cheese, along with honey and jam. There was also juice and coffee. Various coffees could be selected from the coffee machine and they were very good. The breakfast room opened at 7:00 a.m. One morning we had an early tour and I tried to get some juice at 6:50, ten minutes before they "opened". I was immediately kicked out. I tried to explain that we were going on a tour and just wanted some juice to drink on the bus. Too bad, we don't open until 7:00 was the message I got even though the girl spoke minimal English. We had put our passports, return tickets and extra money int the room safe and were able to access it several times without a problem. Then one day it simply wouldn't open!! We were in a panic as we were leaving in 2 days. The desk person said he couldn't do anything about it, but made a note of it for the next day. The next morning someone came and entered a code and it opened. As it turned out, we were not the only one this happened to, another person in our group had the very same thing happen to them. The Siracusa seems to be used a lot for school groups and there always seemed to be a lot of noisy teenagers around. They partied at night making a lot of noise, which we could hear very well, since the walls were so thin. While on the subway, I had my pocket picked. I had carried my wallet on a cord around my neck and one day, just put it in my pocket, with the cord tied to a belt loop. When I got off, the wallet was hanging by the cord and my 15 euros was gone. I think it would be a good idea to get a money belt that goes around the waist. We also noticed a lot of people begging, and this was evident throughout Rome. If we went to Rome again, I think I would give another hotel a try.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, basic accomodation”
Reviews.Author: loulou21
Reviews.Content: Loved the location, right accross from Termini railway station, close to grocery store, all of shopping.... Hotel was basic, continental breakfast basic, elevator very tiny, but room cleaned every morning, did not find too small for a 3 star hotel found it reasonable

Reviews.Title: “Run away as far as you can”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is absolutely terrible. Rooms are filthy and very small. Before entering the room you have to keep windows open at least half an hour to get rid of the smell. Breakfast is even worse. Don't even think of staying here.

HotelInfo.Name: Siracusa
HotelInfo.Address: Via Marsala 50, 00185 Rome, Italy
